document.masterDocTitle: A review of the Munidopsidae Ortmann, 1898 (Decapoda, Galatheoidea) in Chilean waters, including new records for the Southeastern Pacific

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type locality
. Bequia, Lesser Antilles (“Blake” stn 236 :
12 ° 52 ’ 30 ”N
, 61 ° 36 ’002”W).

Distributional range . Western Atlantic, from New Jersey to Bequia, Lesser Antilles; Eastern Atlantic, off Morocco ; Indo-West Pacific from east Africa to Japan , Indonesia , Australia and New Zealand (
Macpherson 2007
; Ahyong 2007 ). Eastern Pacific, Galapagos and Juan Fernandez Islands, Chile (
Haig 1955
). From Acapulco, Mexico up to Galapagos Islands (
Wicksten 1989
). Off Antofagasta, Chile (this report).

New record . MUAP (CD)-0311, 1 ovigerous female cl 44.91 mm , stn AGT- 4 , off Antofagasta (
22 ° 48.07 ’S
,
70 ° 42.29 ’W
, 1775 m ), “ PUCK ” expedition, RV “Sonne",
April–May 2001
.

Description . Rostrum short, directed upwards as strong spine (
Fig. 2
b), overreaching distal part of antennal peduncle, flanked by 2 lateral spines. Carapace subpentagonal densely covered by simple and scale-like tubercles; gastric region armed with strong, long spine of almost half postorbital carapace length; 2 other minor spines on anterior epigastric region (
Fig. 2
a); antennal spines absent; anterolateral spines strong, reaching base of cornea.

Cheliped short, length almost as long as postorbital carapace length, palm slightly shorter than fixed fingers, covered by scale-like tubercles (
Fig. 2
c) as also carpus (
Fig. 2
d). Pereiopods as long as one and one-half times carapace length, surface covered by scale-like tubercles, dactyl armed ventrally by row of more than 15 spines (
Fig 2
e).

Remarks . The specimen collected by the “ PUCK ” expedition without doubt belongs to this species, because
G. rostrata
is easily distinguishable from all other species of the genus (
Macpherson 2007
).

The report of
G. rostrata
from Juan Fernandez archipelago is erroneous (see above as
G. bellis
).
Khodkina ( 1975 )
reported
G. rostrata
from stn 220, 254 from shores of north of Chile and from stn 1968 . Thus, this constitutes a new record to Chile .
